quoteFirst: It comprised all that was required of the servant, from eight in the morning, exactly at which hour Phileas Fogg rose, till half-past eleven, when he left the house for the Reform Club—all the details of service, the tea and toast at twenty-three minutes past eight, the shaving-water at
quoteLast: , and the toilet at twenty minutes before ten. Everything was regulated and foreseen that was to be done from half-past eleven a.m. till midnight, the hour at which the methodical gentleman retired.
title: Around the World in Eighty Days
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905

quoteFirst: On the 17th, at 10:00 a. m., he is just 90° east of the sun; and on the 20th, at
quoteLast: , 4° 17′ north of the moon. His diameter decreases during the month from 37.2″ to 34.2″ and he makes a direct advance of 2° 3′ 51″. On the 1st, he rises at 12:25 p. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, May 1885, No. 8
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: On the contrary, is above the horizon most of the month during the night, rising on the 1st at
quoteLast: ; on the 15th at 8:43 p. m.; and on the 30th at 7:44 p. m. Its motion is about 20′ 52″ retrograde, and its diameter nearly constant at 2.6″. On the 10th, at 5:20 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 04, July 1884, No. 10
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: Fogg invariably arose, to half-past eleven, when he left the house to breakfast at the Reform Club. It comprised everything--the tea and toast at twenty-three minutes past eight, the shaving-water at
quoteLast: , and his attendance at his master's toilet at twenty minutes to ten, and so on. Then from half-past eleven a.m. until midnight, when the methodical Fogg retired to bed, everything was noted down and arranged for.
title: Round the World in Eighty Days
author: Verne, Jules, 1828-1905; Frith, Henry, 1840- [Translator]

quoteLast: . Do you mean to say you have failed once for weeks past to be at the Countess's as the clock strikes twelve?"
title: Doctor Claudius, A True Story
author: Crawford, F. Marion (Francis Marion), 1854-1909
